description: Erection of single storey ground floor rear extension and replace ground floor rear window with new window
decision_conditions: Due to its size and location, the proposal would have an unacceptable impact&nbsp;<span id="docs-internal-guid-67e9ea11-7fff-1dca-0108-d7a77359d721"><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 10pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">on the amenities enjoyed by the occupiers of&nbsp;flat C 10 Powerscroft Road and Nos. 8 and 12 Powerscroft Road. Specifically, its proximity and height with these properties leads to overshadowing, loss of outlook, and reduced daylight and sunlight. As a result, the development does not comply with policy D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) of the London Plan (2021) and policy LP2 (Development and Amenity) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020).</span><div><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"><br></span></div></span>

<span id="docs-internal-guid-b682e83d-7fff-d293-55b5-4aa4c3fc53cc"><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposed extension,&nbsp;by reason of its size, scale, detailed design, and palette of materials, would result in an incompatible and obtrusive form of development, that fails to be subordinate to and in keeping with the character and appearance of the original dwelling, thereby resulting in a harmful impact on the character and appearance of the host dwelling and the wider area.&nbsp; As such, the proposal is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and D4 (Delivering good design) of the London Plan (2021), and policy LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) of Hackney’s Local Plan 2033 (2020) and the relevant sections of Hackney’s Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (2009).</span></p><div><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;"><br></span></div></span>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-f1c6fbf3-7fff-2365-ef62-3970a85e6a53"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:6pt;margin-bottom:6pt;"><span style="font-size:10pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposal does not result in a&nbsp;net biodiversity gain and therefore does not comply with policy G6 (Biodiversity and access to nature) of the London Plan (2021), and policy LP47 (Biodiversity and Sites of Importance of Nature Conservation) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and the GOV UK Planning Practice Guidance for Biodiversity Net Gain (May 2024).&nbsp;</span></p>
